summary.p: 139 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: H. S. 178; Text: Q 11:6-Q 12:52; 5 lines per page; Dimensions: 193 x 133 mm; Script style: kūfī; Estimated date of production: 2nd (8th) to 3rd (9th) centuries [according to Karatay].

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 6: "17 H. S. 178 Kur’an’dan bir bölüm Parşömen. 133mm boy ve 193mm eninde cönk şeklinde 139 yaprak. Sahifede kûfî yazı ile 130mm uzunl.[uğunda] 5 satır. Tahminen II - III. asırda yazılmıştır. Baştan iki ve sondan iki yaprağında arap üslubunda hendesî ve geçmeli levhalar vardır. Miklep, şemse ve kitabeli vişneçürüğü deri cilt. Bu [K]urʿan parçası Hud (11) suresinin 6. ayeti ile başlıyor ve Yūsuf (12) suresinin 52. ayeti ile sona eriyor."

This can be translated as follows: "17 H. S. 178 A part of the Qurʾān Parchment. 139 junk shaped leaves of 133 mm height and 193 mm width. The text area, written in Kufic script [contains] 5 lines measuring 130 mm. Probably copied during the 2nd-3rd [(8th-9th)] centuries. There are geometrical and interlaced plates in Arabic style on the two leaves from the beginning and the two from the last. Cherry-brown-colored leather binding with flap (miklep), mandorla (şemse) and inscription (kitabe). The part of Qurʾān begins with Q 11:6 (Sūra Hūd) and ends with Q 12:52 (Sūra Yūsuf)."
